column4: ﻿lucas2:  find the common MAC addy and you should be able to figure it out  in terminal > sudo lshw -C network   and   ifconfig -a
I found the device in lshw.  there is no driver= entry in the configuration line however.
﻿﻿lucas2:   then check in terminal (to see which is aliased) > cat /etc/modprobe.d/aliases
DozenOnLinux: not sure what to look for in that file.  I don't see anything stand out that looks related to wireless network.
﻿lucas2:  i have seen that issue before somewhere in the forums, i just need to recall where
﻿ ﻿lucas2: thats 3 links if its hard to see
that is just to give you an idea, please dont take that as a fix. you need to know what card is what first
DozenOnLinux: no worries, any leads are welcome.
﻿ ﻿lucas2: tell me when you are done reviewing and maybe i can help you out from there, if not, someone else in here prob can
it looks like the ubuntu wireless guide had the missing link.  it mentinos a few drivers to blacklist.  on a first inspection that seemed to have worked.
I added 4 drivers to that file just a minute ago.
